payload.name: heuristic
payload.core: Apply simple rules of thumb that often work to make fast decisions. Trade accuracy for speed when speed matters more than precision.
proc: recognize situation type from surface features
retrieve applicable rule of thumb from experience
apply heuristic to generate candidate answer
check for obvious violations or red flags
accept result if stakes are low or refine if stakes are high
check: time or resource constraint justifies shortcut
fallback to deeper analysis identified for high-stakes cases

diff.satisficing: satisficing accepts first good-enough option; heuristic uses rules to skip evaluation entirely
diff.fermi: Fermi decomposes into rough estimates; heuristic applies cached rules without decomposition
diff.debiasing: debiasing corrects heuristic errors; heuristic embraces speed over correction

fail.name: heuristics become doctrine
signals: rules of thumb treated as universal laws
no exceptions permitted despite changed context
heuristic origin forgotten, only rule remembered
resistance to evidence contradicting the rule
mitigations: label heuristics as provisional shortcuts, not truths
track failure rate and domain boundaries
schedule periodic review of ossified rules
pair with calibration checks on high-stakes decisions

ex.scenario: Bug triage: 200 tickets, 2 hours to prioritize. Heuristic: 'customer-reported > internal, crash > cosmetic, recent > old'.
steps: apply three-factor sort without reading details
top 20 tickets flagged for deep review
spot-check 5 random tickets for heuristic failures
refine heuristic if spot-check shows systematic misses
